shapes3d

Class Mesh2DCoreWithCaps

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes3d.Shape3D
      • shapes3d.Mesh2DCore
        • shapes3d.Mesh2DCoreWithCaps
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PConstants, SConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BezTube, Extrusion, Helix, PathTube, Tube

    public class Mesh2DCoreWithCaps
extends Mesh2DCore
    This class extends the Mesh2DCore class to enable the use of end caps for the all 3D shapes that have open ends. This includes the Tube and Extrusion classes.
    It also provides methods to control the draw mode and visibility of the end caps also this class includes methods to set the texture, fill color, stroke color and stroke weight for the end caps.
    All these parameters can be set independently for each end cap based on the second parameter in the setter methods.
    The second parameter is
    Tube.S_CAP, Tube.E_CAP or Tube.BOTHCAP
    these
    Helix.S_CAP, Helix.E_CAP or Helix.BOTHCAP
    are also valid
    Author:
    Peter Lager

    • Method Detail

      • visible

        public void visible(boolean vis,
           int caps)
        Change the visibility of end caps. Note if the body to invisible then the end caps will not be displayed.
        Parameters:
        vis - visibility
        caps - which cap(s) affected

      • drawMode

        public void drawMode(int mode,
            int caps)
        Sets the draw mode for the end caps shape.
        The three constants Shape3D.SOILD, Shape3D.WIRE and Shape3D.TEXTURE are used to determine how the shape is drawn. These can be ored together to get different drawing combinations e.g. Shape3D.SOLID | Shape3D.WIRE would be a coloured shape with edges. If the parameter is Shape3D.TEXTURE then and a texture has not been set then it will use SOLID.
        Overrides:
        drawMode in class Shape3D
        Parameters:
        mode - end-cap draw mode
        caps - caps which cap(s) affected
